We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Engineer Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with Google BigQuery (GBQ), PostgreSQL, and ETL technologies. This role will involve leading the data engineering team, designing and implementing scalable data pipelines, and optimizing our data infrastructure. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data availability, reliability, and performance. Key Responsibilities: Leadership and Strategy: Lead and mentor a team of data engineers, providing technical guidance and fostering a collaborative environment. Develop and execute data engineering strategies that align with business objectives. Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions. Data Engineering and Implementation: Design, develop, and implement robust ETL processes to ensure the efficient ingestion, transformation, and loading of data from various sources into GBQ and PostgreSQL. Architect and manage scalable data pipelines and workflows to handle large volumes of data and support real-time analytics. Optimize and maintain data infrastructure, including GBQ and PostgreSQL databases, for performance and reliability. Data Management and Optimization: Monitor data pipelines and databases to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and availability. Implement best practices for data governance, security, and compliance. Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues, including performance bottlenecks and data quality problems. Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with other engineering teams to integrate data solutions with existing systems and applications. Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and effective manner. Prepare and present regular reports on data engineering metrics, progress, and initiatives. Qualifications: Education and Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field. Master’s degree preferred. 7+ years of experience in data engineering, with at least 3 years in a lead or senior role. Proven experience with Google BigQuery (GBQ), PostgreSQL, and ETL technologies. Technical Skills: Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with advanced SQL functions and performance tuning. Hands-on experience with ETL tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Airflow, Talend, Informatica). Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Google Cloud Platform, AWS) and data warehousing concepts. Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or Java for data processing and automation. Soft Skills: Excellent leadership and team management skills. Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical skills. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with additional data storage technologies and data lakes. Familiarity with machine learning and data science workflows. Certifications related to Google Cloud Platform or data engineering.

Job scope: Machine & Equipment Management Supervise the operation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of machinery used in the food manufacturing process. Lead and manage equipment breakdown analysis, root cause analysis, and corrective actions. Collaborate with suppliers and vendors for repairs, upgrades, or new machine installations. Ensure that machines are running optimally, minimizing downtime and improving production efficiency. Implement continuous improvement initiatives to enhance machine performance and energy efficiency. WWTP (Wastewater Treatment Plant) Management Oversee the operation and maintenance of the WWTP to ensure compliance with local environmental regulations. Monitor the performance of the treatment plant and troubleshoot any issues related to wastewater treatment processes. Ensure that effluent quality meets the regulatory standards set by Malaysia Department of Environment (DOE). Coordinate regular inspection, maintenance, and calibration of WWTP equipment. Manage chemical dosing, sludge handling, and other critical operational processes. Maintain and update records of the wastewater treatment process, reports, and compliance documentation. Building & Facilities Maintenance Manage the overall maintenance of the facility infrastructure, including HVAC systems, electrical, plumbing, and general building upkeep. Ensure the facility meets safety, hygiene, and compliance standards for food manufacturing. Plan for repairs, renovations, and facility upgrades as needed to improve operational efficiency. Monitor energy usage and develop strategies to optimize the use of utilities to reduce costs. Work with other departments to maintain a clean and safe environment, in line with food safety regulations. Team Management & Leadership Provide training and development opportunities for the team to ensure they are skilled in handling the machinery and systems. Develop work schedules and assign tasks to team members while ensuring timely completion of maintenance tasks. Ensure proper documentation and reporting of maintenance activities, incidents, and team performance. Health, Safety, and Compliance Enforce safety protocols for all maintenance activities and ensure compliance with local safety standards. Ensure compliance with food safety regulations, environmental policies, and industrial hygiene standards. Ensure all staff comply with safety protocols and wear the necessary personal protective equipment (PPE) to mitigate health risks. Vendor and Supplier Management Coordinate with external contractors, suppliers, and service providers for maintenance and equipment repairs. Negotiate and manage contracts related to facility maintenance, machinery service, and WWTP. Oversee the procurement process for spare parts, chemicals, tools, and other necessary materials. Requirement: Bachelor’s degree in mechanical/ manufacturing engineering or any related field Minimum 3 years relevant experience in facilities maintenance preferably within the food industry. Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work under minimal supervision. Hands-on experience in troubleshooting and repairing building structures and utilities. A team player who is self-motivated and exhibits continuous improvement and drive with initiative. Positive attitude, responsibility and willing to learn.

Job Title: (FRESH GRAD ONLY) Engineer, Software Development Engineering (Apps)
Job Responsibilities: Company Description At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible. At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we’ve been doing just that—our technology helped people put a man on the moon and capture the first-ever picture of a black hole. We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, HDDs, and platforms for business, creative professionals, and consumers alike under our Western Digital®, WD®, WD_BLACKTM, and SanDisk® Professional brands. We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest-growth organizations in the world. From enabling systems to make cities safer and more connected, to powering the data centers behind many of the world’s biggest companies and hyperscale cloud providers, to meeting the massive and ever-growing data storage needs of the AI era, Western Digital is fueling a brighter, smarter future. Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. Together, we can build the future of data storage. Job Description ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Design, develop, test, integrate and maintain quality firmware for eHDD using best practices like unit test, CI and Agile methodologies. Design and implementation of data structures, software algorithms, data path, and drivers for hardware cores using latest standards C++ and Python. Participate in Scrum & Agile processes to bring up new hardware and develop embedded firmware for data storage products. Deliver cutting-edge storage products with SAS, SATA, PCIE interfaces. Collaborate and design solutions for the challenging yet unique problems across hardware and software platforms, including servers, RAID, and various operating systems (Windows and Linux). Participate in planning and coordinating significant technical investigations from problem statement to conclusions. Creates design documents pertinent to the various phases of firmware development. Qualifications REQUIRED: Bachelor or Master in Computer Science, Computer/Electronics Engineering or equivalent. Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply. Knowledge in C/C++, object-oriented programming, Python, data structures, algorithms. Capable of quickly learning new firmware, hardware, systems, tools, and methodologies. PREFERRED: Familiarity with micro-controller architecture (ARM or ARC), embedded systems and RTOS desired. Knowledge in SAS, SATA and PCIE interface. Experience in the use of bus analyzers, emulators and other firmware debugging tools is a plus. Possess data analytics skillset such as machine learning. Working experience as a Scrum Master or understanding of Agile practices would be an added advantage. SKILLS Ability to effectively manage projects and tasks to deliver deadlines and commitments. You have high degree of problem-solving skills, solutions oriented with a positive, can-do attitude. You have excellent interpersonal skills, including written and verbal communication. You are comfortable and enjoy working in a dynamic and ever evolving environment. You can be a fun and enthusiastic teammate who enjoys challenges and celebrates successes. Additional Information Western Digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution. Western Digital is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at jobs.accommodations@wdc.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying. NOTICE TO CANDIDATES: Western Digital has received reports of scams where a payment is requested on Western Digital’s behalf as a condition for receiving an offer of employment. Please be aware that Western Digital and its subsidiaries will never request payment as a condition for applying for a position or receiving an offer of employment. Should you encounter any such requests, please report it immediately to Western Digitals Ethics Helpline or email compliance@wdc.com

Job Title: JUNIOR FPGA (Field Programmable Gate Arrays) Engineer
Job Responsibilities: Position Overview: We are looking for a skilled FPGA Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HDL design, FPGA development tools, and digital logic design, as well as a passion for creating innovative solutions. You will be responsible for developing and testing FPGA designs, integrating open-source soft IP cores, and ensuring system reliability through rigorous debugging and optimization. Key Responsibilities: ● Design, develop, and verify FPGA-based systems using HDLs such as Verilog, SystemVerilog, or VHDL. ● Work with development tools like Xilinx Vivado, Lattice Diamond/Radiant, and OpenFPGA for synthesis, simulation, and implementation. ● Test and validate the correctness of RTL designs. ● Stitch open-source soft IP cores (e.g., RISC-V cores like VexRiscv) with other hardware IPs. ● Develop and debug FPGA designs using interfaces such as AXI, Wishbone, Ethernet, I2C, SPI, and UART. ● Perform timing analysis and place-and-route tasks to meet design constraints. ● Debug and optimize hardware designs in real-time using tools like ChipScope/ILA, SignalTap, and logic analyzers. ● Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project requirements and deliverables. Required Skills and Expertise: HDL Proficiency: ● Strong knowledge of Verilog, System Verilog, and/or VHDL for RTL design. ● Familiarity with high-level HDLs like Spinal HDL, Chisel, or Bluespec System Verilog. FPGA Development Tools: ● Hands-on experience with Xilinx Vivado, Intel Quartus Prime, and Lattice Diamond/Radiant. ● Proficiency in simulation tools such as Model Sim, QuestaSim, or Verilator for debugging and verification. Synthesis and Implementation: ● Knowledge of synthesis and timing analysis, including setup and hold timing, to ensure reliable designs. ● Familiarity with place-and-route tools like Vivado P&R or Quartus Fitter. Hardware Debugging: ● Hands-on experience with logic analyzers, oscilloscopes, and FPGA-specific tools like Chip Scope/ILA or Signal Tap. ● Ability to debug and optimize hardware designs in real time. Digital Design Fundamentals: ● Strong understanding of combinational and sequential circuits, finite state machines, and pipelining. ● Familiarity with concepts like clock domain crossing, low-power design, and latency optimization. What You Will Be Working On: ● Testing and validating the correctness of RTL codes. ● Integrating open-source soft IP cores with various other IPs to create cohesive systems. Nice to Have: ● A portfolio showcasing previous FPGA projects and designs. ● Contributions to open-source FPGA or hardware projects. ● Familiarity with open-source toolchains like SymbiFlow and Yosys. What We Offer: ● Opportunity to work on cutting-edge FPGA projects. ● A collaborative and innovative work environment. ● Continuous learning and growth opportunities. ● Flexible work arrangements and competitive compensation.

Alpha X is an innovative high-tech manufacturing technology company pioneering the integration of advanced automation, transportation and AI-driven solutions to revolutionize traditional manufacturing processes. We harness the power of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and robotics to optimize production efficiency, enhance product quality, and foster sustainability across diverse high-tech industries. The Role We are seeking an experienced Solution Architect – CIM to lead the design and implementation of advanced manufacturing solutions for our solar production facilities. This role will focus on integrating manufacturing execution systems (MES), automation, and data analytics to optimize production efficiency and quality. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in semiconductor, solar, or electronics manufacturing, with expertise in CIM architecture and smart factory solutions. What you will do: Define and design CIM architectures to support smart manufacturing in solar production lines. Lead MES integration with shop floor automation, SCADA, ERP, and data analytics platforms. Develop IIoT and digital twin strategies for real-time monitoring and predictive analytics. Ensure seamless equipment connectivity (SECS/GEM, OPC UA, MQTT, etc.) with manufacturing systems. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (IT, Operations, Engineering) to ensure smooth implementation of CIM solutions. Drive standardization and modularization of system architecture to enhance scalability and flexibility. Oversee data governance and analytics frameworks to improve manufacturing KPIs. Provide technical guidance on cloud-based or hybrid CIM solutions for better resource optimization. Conduct system evaluations, proof-of-concepts, and feasibility studies for new technologies. Ensure cybersecurity and compliance with industry standards and regulations. What you need to have: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 8+ years of experience in CIM, MES, or smart manufacturing system design in the solar, semiconductor, or electronics industry. Strong knowledge of SECS/GEM, OPC UA, MQTT, MES, SCADA, and IIoT protocols. Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and edge computing. Familiarity with big data, AI/ML applications, and predictive analytics for manufacturing. Proficiency in database systems (SQL, NoSQL, time-series databases) and data pipeline design. Excellent understanding of automation frameworks, PLCs, and factory integration strategies. Strong problem-solving and communication skills, with the ability to bridge IT and OT teams. Experience with agile project management and DevOps methodologies is a plus. Preferred Certifications: PMP, TOGAF, or relevant architectural framework certification. Certified in cloud technologies (AWS Solutions Architect, Azure Architect, etc.). Six Sigma, Lean Manufacturing, or similar process improvement certifications. You’ll only be the right candidate if you are aligned to our values and culture: Collaborative entrepreneurial spirit Winning through customers High ethical standards, openness and trust Expectations for results Respect and value people If you believe you match our values and have the experience we’re looking for, then apply! We can’t wait to hear from you.

At Deriv, we are at the cutting edge of financial technology, revolutionizing CFD trading through AI. Our goal is to automate and optimize all aspects of operations, delivering unparalleled performance, innovation, and scalability. We are looking for a highly skilled AI Engineer to lead the development of sophisticated AI-driven systems that empower our business. What You’ll Do: As an AI Engineer at Deriv, you will design and implement advanced AI solutions, integrating them across all operational facets, from trading algorithms to customer experience. Key responsibilities include: Advanced Modeling: Develop and deploy deep learning, reinforcement learning, and graph neural networks for predictive analytics, automated trading strategies, and decision-making systems. NLP Applications: Implement state-of-the-art NLP solutions for sentiment analysis, document processing, and customer interaction enhancements using tools like spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers, and OpenAI APIs. Vector Search and Semantic Retrieval: Build systems utilizing vector databases like Weaviate, Pinecone, and Milvus to enable real-time, context-aware data retrieval. Agentic Systems: Design autonomous and multi-agent systems for dynamic decision-making and complex task management in trading environments. MLOps Integration: Deploy and maintain AI models at scale using tools such as MLflow, Kubeflow, TensorFlow Serving, and Seldon for seamless production workflows. Big Data Engineering: Architect high-performance data pipelines using Apache Spark, Kafka, and Hadoop for real-time and batch processing. Generative AI: Explore and integrate generative technologies, including GPT, DALL-E, and GANs, for innovative applications in user experience and content generation. Transformers and Architectures: Utilize advanced transformer models like BERT, T5, and ViT to solve complex problems in NLP and computer vision. Explainability and Fairness: Incorporate tools like SHAP, LIME, and Fairlearn to ensure AI systems are transparent, interpretable, and unbiased. Optimization: Use advanced hyperparameter tuning tools like Optuna and Ray Tune to maximize model performance. Cloud and Edge AI: Implement scalable AI systems on cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) and optimize for edge computing with TensorFlow Lite and NVIDIA Jetson. What You’ll Need: We are looking for a candidate with exceptional technical expertise and a track record of delivering impactful AI solutions. Technical Skills: Programming Expertise: Proficiency in Python, R, C++, or Java. Deep Learning Frameworks: Expertise in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn. Data Tools: Experience with Pandas, NumPy, and HDFS for data analysis and storage. Vector Databases: Knowledge of Weaviate, Pinecone, Milvus, or Annoy for similarity-based retrieval systems. Reinforcement Learning: Experience with tools like OpenAI Gym, Ray RLlib, and Stable Baselines. Generative AI Models: Familiarity with GANs, StyleGAN, BigGAN, and transformer-based models for various applications. MLOps and Automation: Proficiency in Docker, Kubernetes, MLflow, Kubeflow, and Seldon for scaling AI operations. Real-Time Processing: Hands-on experience with Flink, Kafka, and event stream processing for dynamic data workflows. Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills. Ability to collaborate effectively across teams. Proven ability to deliver under tight deadlines. Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or related fields. Why Join Us? Work on transformative AI projects with real-world impact. Collaborate with an innovative and forward-thinking team. Competitive compensation and growth opportunities. Access to cutting-edge technologies and learning resources.

Company Description At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible. At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we’ve been doing just that—our technology helped people put a man on the moon and capture the first-ever picture of a black hole. We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, HDDs, and platforms for business, creative professionals, and consumers alike under our Western Digital®, WD®, WD_BLACKTM, and SanDisk® Professional brands. We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest-growth organizations in the world. Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. Together, we can build the future of data storage. Job Title: SENIOR FPGA (Field Programmable Gate Arrays) Engineer
Job Responsibilities: Position Overview: We are looking for a skilled FPGA Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HDL design, FPGA development tools, and digital logic design, as well as a passion for creating innovative solutions. You will be responsible for developing and testing FPGA designs, integrating open-source soft IP cores, and ensuring system reliability through rigorous debugging and optimization. Key Responsibilities: ● Design, develop, and verify FPGA-based systems using HDLs such as Verilog, SystemVerilog, or VHDL. ● Work with development tools like Xilinx Vivado, Lattice Diamond/Radiant, and OpenFPGA for synthesis, simulation, and implementation. ● Test and validate the correctness of RTL designs. ● Stitch open-source soft IP cores (e.g., RISC-V cores like VexRiscv) with other hardware IPs. ● Develop and debug FPGA designs using interfaces such as AXI, Wishbone, Ethernet, I2C, SPI, and UART. ● Perform timing analysis and place-and-route tasks to meet design constraints. ● Debug and optimize hardware designs in real-time using tools like ChipScope/ILA, SignalTap, and logic analyzers. ● Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project requirements and deliverables. Required Skills and Expertise: HDL Proficiency: ● Strong knowledge of Verilog, System Verilog, and/or VHDL for RTL design. ● Familiarity with high-level HDLs like Spinal HDL, Chisel, or Bluespec System Verilog. FPGA Development Tools: ● Hands-on experience with Xilinx Vivado, Intel Quartus Prime, and Lattice Diamond/Radiant. ● Proficiency in simulation tools such as Model Sim, QuestaSim, or Verilator for debugging and verification. Synthesis and Implementation: ● Knowledge of synthesis and timing analysis, including setup and hold timing, to ensure reliable designs. ● Familiarity with place-and-route tools like Vivado P&R or Quartus Fitter. Hardware Debugging: ● Hands-on experience with logic analyzers, oscilloscopes, and FPGA-specific tools like Chip Scope/ILA or Signal Tap. ● Ability to debug and optimize hardware designs in real time. Digital Design Fundamentals: ● Strong understanding of combinational and sequential circuits, finite state machines, and pipelining. ● Familiarity with concepts like clock domain crossing, low-power design, and latency optimization. What You Will Be Working On: ● Testing and validating the correctness of RTL codes. ● Integrating open-source soft IP cores with various other IPs to create cohesive systems. Nice to Have: ● A portfolio showcasing previous FPGA projects and designs. ● Contributions to open-source FPGA or hardware projects. ● Familiarity with open-source toolchains like SymbiFlow and Yosys. What We Offer: ● Opportunity to work on cutting-edge FPGA projects. ● A collaborative and innovative work environment. ● Continuous learning and growth opportunities. ● Flexible work arrangements and competitive compensation.

Job Responsibilities : • Responsible for thermal solutions design to meet product requirements • Conduct the detailed thermal assessment by calculation and simulation analysis to ensure the optimal thermal solution implemented • Responsible for delivering comprehensive thermal proposal for RFQ technical response and presenting thermal proposal to customers • Work closely with heat sink vendors to develop cost-efficient heat sink solutions to meet performance and cost target • Provide a power-saving fan speed control strategy and work closely with software team to ensure fan speed control implemented • Participate in thermal technology research and development to meet the thermal requirements of future IT equipment • Provide innovative and creative solutions to resolve thermal challenges and issues • Establish and improve thermal process and guideline Job Requirement : • Minimum 5 years experience in thermal design/simulation/test validation for data centre IT equipment • Strong user of Flotherm as CFD analysis tool for performing steady state simulation analysis, transient analysis is a plus • Expertise in various heat sinks, heat pipe, Vapor chamber design/selection as well as Air mover, • TIM selection, liquid cooling or other advanced cooling technology experience is a plus • Expertise and experience in various fan speed control methodology and over-temperature protection mechanism • Familiar with thermal measurement technology and test tools such as temperature data logger, IR camera, wind tunnel, air speed meter etc. • Familiar with Mechanical design tool such as Creo for 3D model check, tolerance analysis methodology for heat sink retention design is a plus • Familiar with industry standard including NEBS, GR-63, ASHRAE, MSA,etc

You will integrate security into the DevOps pipeline, develop secure infrastructure, and perform DevOps tasks to ensure the efficiency and security of the development lifecycle. If you're passionate about security automation and continuous improvement, we encourage you to apply. Responsibilities: Containerization & CI/CD Pipeline Automation:: Design, build, and manage containerized applications using Docker and Kubernetes, ensuring scalability, reliability, and optimal performance. Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines (using tools like Jenkins) to automate the code-to-production process, integrating testing and security checks. Optimize cloud costs and resource usage by leveraging container orchestration and efficient pipeline workflows. 2. Automation & Infrastructure Management: Automate infrastructure provisioning and configuration using scripting languages (e.g., Groovy, Bash) and configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible). Utilize orchestration tools like Kubernetes to manage and scale applications and clusters in cloud environments. Streamline operational workflows by automating deployment, monitoring, and scaling tasks. 3. Security Automation & Compliance: Continuously optimize and automate security workflows to enhance threat detection, incident response, and operational efficiency, providing reports and actionable recommendations for improvement. Configure system auto-detection and self-quarantine features, work closely with development and operations teams to share information and stay synchronized. 4. Security & Integration: Design, develop, and implement scalable, efficient security solutions to meet infrastructure and security requirements, including vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and threat detection. Integrate security best practices into CI/CD pipelines, ensuring secure processes across development and production. Monitor and respond to security incidents promptly and effectively, ensuring swift resolution. Develop and enforce security policies, ensuring compliance with relevant standards and frameworks. Conduct risk assessments and provide actionable recommendations for improvement. 5. Collaboration & Strategic Initiatives: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive and support strategic security initiatives, and assist with DevOps tasks. Configure and manage security rules to protect applications from potential vulnerabilities. Analyze HTTP headers and cookies to identify and remediate security risks. Provide reports on security automation efforts, outlining areas for improvement and detailing results. What we look for: Education & Experience: Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related fields. Minimum of 5 years of experience in DevOps or security roles, with practical experience in DevOps and the ability to integrate security practices. Strong knowledge and hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab) for automating the software development lifecycle. Experience with microservices, containerized applications, and orchestration tools like Kubernetes. Practical experience with Huawei Cloud products and other cloud platforms. Experience with security tools like SAST, DAST and OWASP ZAP. Strong background in scripting languages (YAML, JSON, Shell/Bash) and programming languages (Groovy, Python, Java, or C#). Technical Skills: Expertise in managing cloud platforms and hybrid cloud environments, with deep knowledge of Huawei Cloud, Alibaba Cloud, AWS, and others. Strong understanding of network security, network protocols, threat analysis, incident response, and familiarity with security standards and frameworks such as NIST, ISO/IEC 27001, OWASP, Diamond Model, MITRE ATT&CK, SaaS Attack, and DeTTECT. Use open-source monitoring and log aggregation tools to centralize security logs and vulnerabilities, integrating with a SIEM system for real-time detection and response. Experience in managing and optimizing security systems like SIEM, SOC, IPS and Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) platforms. Proven experience managing CDN services. Familiarity with the REST API model and its security considerations. Experienced in setting up and optimizing Kafka, Zookeeper, MySQL, MongoDB, and Redis clusters for scalability, availability, and performance. Soft Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities, with the ability to troubleshoot issues in complex distributed systems and provide efficient solutions. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, able to work effectively with cross-functional teams (development, testing, infrastructure). Self-starter and strong autonomy, capable of independently designing and implementing automation solutions. Attention to detail, ensuring high-quality deliverables and robust system performance. Appetite and basic knowledge and interest in new technologies. Bonus Points: Certifications such as CISSP, CEH, or Huawei Cloud Certified Architect/Engineer, and proficiency with security tools like OpenVas, Acunetix, SQLMap, Burp Suite, Metasploit, and Nessus. Familiarity with Chef for configuration management and automation deployment. Experience with service registration and configuration tools like Nacos for managing distributed services. Appetite and basic knowledge and interest in new technologies (machine learning, blockchain, AI, cybersecurity) Benefits: 13th Annual Wages + Yearly Increment Project Bonus Annual Leave / Medical Leave Electronic Claims Flexible Working Hours Well-Stocked Office Pantry Positive Work Environment Say "NO" to office politics, a young company with more opportunity

Job Title: [Master's Fresh Grad ONLY] - Senior Engineer, Software Development Engineering
Job Responsibilities: Company Description At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible. Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. Together, we can build the future of data storage. Job Description ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Design, develop, test, integrate and maintain test scripts using Python to validate WD eHDD firmware and hardware features to ensure WD product meets the quality specifications using best practices like unit test, CI and Agile methodologies. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to discern, strategize, and synchronize creative methods for testing firmware functionality. Customize test suites to align with evolving customer and firmware requirements, as well as future architectural demands. Contribute to failure analysis efforts aimed at enhancing firmware quality robustness. Collaborate on the development and refinement of internal processes to enhance overall efficiency and performance. Participate in Scrum & Agile processes to strategically plan, execute, and coordinate the team's activities. Deliver cutting-edge storage products with SAS, SATA, PCIE interfaces. Qualifications REQUIRED: Bachelor or Master in Computer Science, Computer/Electronics Engineering or equivalent. Minimum 2 years of working experience in relevant field or software quality development. Hands on experience in object-oriented programming, Python, data structures, algorithms. Capable of quickly learning new technologies, complex code. Strong aptitude and penchant for problem solving, and complexity analysis. PREFERRED: Familiarity with micro-controller architecture (ARM or ARC), embedded systems and RTOS desired. Knowledge in SAS, SATA and PCIE interface. Experience in the use of bus analyzers, emulators and other firmware debugging tools is a plus. Possess data analytics skillset such as machine learning. Working experience as a Scrum team member or understanding of Agile practices would be an added advantage. SKILLS: Ability to effectively manage projects and tasks to deliver deadlines and commitments. You have high degree of problem-solving skills, solutions oriented with a positive, can-do attitude. You have excellent interpersonal skills, including written and verbal communication. You are comfortable and enjoy working in a dynamic and ever evolving environment. You can be a fun and enthusiastic teammate who enjoys challenges and celebrates successes. Self-motivated, self-directed and ability to work well with people. Proven experience as a software designer and/or software lead Additional Information Western Digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution. Western Digital is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at jobs.accommodations@wdc.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying. NOTICE TO CANDIDATES: Western Digital has received reports of scams where a payment is requested on Western Digital’s behalf as a condition for receiving an offer of employment. Please be aware that Western Digital and its subsidiaries will never request payment as a condition for applying for a position or receiving an offer of employment. Should you encounter any such requests, please report it immediately to Western Digitals Ethics Helpline or email compliance@wdc.com

Overview: As a Site/System Reliability Engineer (SRE), you will play a key role in maintaining the reliability and performance of critical services. Your expertise will help bridge the gap between development and operations, ensuring robust, scalable, and responsive infrastructure. This role emphasizes strong system architecture and design principles, focusing on key SRE practices such as Service Level Objectives (SLOs), Service Level Indicators (SLIs), and the reduction of operational toil. You will collaborate closely with diverse teams to drive reliability improvements and foster a culture of continuous learning and accountability. Key Responsibilities: Design and implement resilient system architectures that support high availability and scalability. Develop automation tools and scripts to enhance operational efficiency and reduce manual effort. Define, track, and analyze SLOs and SLIs to ensure reliability and performance meet business needs. Conduct thorough post-mortem analyses following incidents, driving continuous improvement through root cause identification and solution implementation. Collaborate with development and operations teams to establish best practices in system reliability and incident management. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to database performance, network connectivity, and deployment failures, including diagnosing problems at the underlying platform level (e.g., Kubernetes, virtual machines). Ensure that issues are resolved within the stipulated Service Level Agreements (SLAs), maintaining high standards of service delivery. Identify and troubleshoot performance bottlenecks across systems, providing actionable recommendations for enhancements. Maintain detailed documentation of processes and incident responses to support knowledge sharing and compliance. Qualifications: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Golang, Java, or similar, focusing on operational efficiency. Demonstrated experience in system architecture and design, prioritizing reliability, and scalability. Strong understanding of SRE principles, including SLOs, SLIs, toil reduction, and incident post-mortems. Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their operational management. Strong expertise in Linux system administration. Proven experience in troubleshooting application support issues with a focus on performance and connectivity. Familiarity with networking concepts and effective troubleshooting techniques. Excellent problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach to operational challenges. Ability to work independently while effectively collaborating within a team environment. Preferred Skills: Familiarity with monitoring tools and performance optimization techniques. Experience in scripting or automation for system administration tasks. Knowledge of networking concepts and troubleshooting methodologies. Hands-on knowledge of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their services. Familiarity with DevOps practices and frameworks, including CI/CD, infrastructure as code, and containerization.

Who You Are: Sr. Manufacturing Engineer - PLC Expert. Position Summary: Sr. Manufacturing Engineer -PLC Expert responsible for all NPI (New Product Introduction) and Operation (High Volume Production) in Level 2 process engineering. What You Will Do: Subject Matter Expert (SME) in Robotic equipment with PLC software, provided with process problem solving skills. Develop and establish new Control Plan, FMEA, and Operating Instruction for new products and processes. Continuously work with cross functional team to improve in integral yield for assembly processes. To work with vendor to prepare jig, fixture, stencils prior to New Product Introduction (NPI) and Manufacturing Process Validation (MPV) during Operation product run. Able to hands on in set up the equipment's recipe and optimize machine and process parameters to meet customer and internal requirements. Develop and qualify new equipment, tools and processes. To use statistic analytical tools such as SPC, MSA and Gauge R&R in defining the process and equipment capabilities (Tools as Minitab and JMP Software). To support production for daily quality related issue. Collaborate with production personnel and Equipment Engineer for UPH and OEE improvement. Able to work independently with minimum guidance. Deep dive in analyze root cause with 5 Why analysis, Fish Bone Diagram to determine the Correction, Corrective Action and Preventive Action. Drive supplier/vendor on the manufacturing feasibility to meet customer requirements. Attend to customer, ISO and IATF audit. Manage to present in front of audience, customer and counterpart with confidence. Good exposure to measurement machine such as Minitab (software), JMP (software), Nikon, Mitutoyo or MMS is an added advantage Knowledge in PCBA design with DFM mindset. Who You Are: Sr. Manufacturing Engineer - SMT. Position Summary: Sr. Manufacturing Engineer SMT responsible for all NPI (New Product Introduction) and Operation (High Volume Production) in Level 2 process engineering. What You Will Do: Subject Matter Expert (SME) in SMT equipment provided also with process problem solving skills. Develop and qualify new equipment, tools and processes. Develop and establish new Control Plan, FMEA, and Operating Instruction for new products and processes. Continuously work with cross functional team to improve in integral yield for assembly processes. To work with vendor to prepare jig, fixture, stencils prior to New Product Introduction (NPI) and Manufacturing Process Validation (MPV) during Operation product run. Able to hands on in set up the equipment's recipe (SMT and others equipment/tools) and optimize machine and process parameters to meet customer and internal requirements. To use statistic analytical tools such as SPC, MSA and Gauge R&R in defining the process and equipment capabilities (Tools as Minitab and JMP Software). To support production for daily quality related issue. Collaborate with production personnel and Equipment Engineer for UPH and OEE improvement. Able to work independently with minimum guidance. Deep dive in analyze root cause with 5 Why analysis, Fish Bone Diagram to determine the Correction in Containment Action, Corrective Action and Preventive Action. Drive supplier/vendor on the manufacturing feasibility to meet customer requirements. Attend to customer, ISO and IATF audit. Manage to present in front of audience, customer and counterpart with confidence. What You Will Bring (Required Qualifications): 3-5+ years managing process engineering team (AE and Tech) for support production. Education (Minimum Level) Bachelor's Field of Study Electrical or Mechanical Engineering, or related fields Years of Experience (Minimum) 5 - 7 years Preferred Qualifications: Minimum 5 years working experience in PCBA and HLA assembly processes. Knowhow in PCB separation, routing, glue dispensing and developing poka yoke jig and fixture for HLA. Advanced problem solving skills and verbal communication skills. Good exposure to measurement machine such as Minitab (software), JMP (software), Nikon, Mitutoyo or MMS is an added advantage. Knowledge in PCBA design with DFM mindset. Lumileds is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

A Snapshot of Your Day The On-Site Machining (OSM) Engineer is responsible for reviewing project plans and machining requirements, providing guidance to project teams, and ensuring the readiness of mobile machining equipment for on-site execution. They program CNC machines, coordinate with stakeholders, and supervise machining activities to meet project timelines and quality standards. Additionally, the OSM Engineer may engage in research and development to enhance machining techniques and collaborate with management on training and maintenance strategies. Safety and quality are paramount, ensuring compliance with regulations to minimize workplace risks and costs. How You’ll Make an Impact Review project specifications and collaborate with local Project Teams and technical specialists to develop machining strategies and procedures. Conduct on-site mobile machining tasks using specialized equipment, including CNC programming and precision alignment. Supervise subcontracted off-site machining activities and perform simple machining tasks on external machinery as needed. Maintain and troubleshoot mobile machining equipment, ensuring it meets regulatory and operational standards. Ensure sufficient stock of machining consumables and spare parts for optimal equipment availability. Adhere to quality and safety standards, complying with Siemens Energy and client specifications. Maintain accurate records of machining operations, maintenance activities, and equipment logs. Evaluate subcontractors and local machine shops for technical adequacy and safety compliance. What You Bring Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or vocational education in machining with hands-on experience. Proficiency in CNC programming, with experience in Siemens control systems - Siemens 840D and SINUMERIK Operate will be an advantage. Strong knowledge of precision measurement instruments and techniques. Excellent problem-solving skills and adaptability to challenging on-site conditions with proactive attitude in take on additional tasks for improvement. Understanding of technical equipment and ability to interpret technical documentation. Digital literacy and proficiency in Microsoft Office; additional IT skills are a plus. Team player with resilience, capable of working independently under pressure and multitasking. Willingness to travel internationally on short notice and work flexible hours. About the Team Our Gas Services division offers Low-emission power generation through service and decarbonization. Zero or low emission power generation and all gas turbines under one roof, steam turbines and generators. Decarbonization opportunities through service offerings, modernization, and digitalization of the fleet. Who is Siemens Energy? At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. With ~100,000 dedicated employees in more than 90 countries, we develop the energy systems of the future, ensuring that the growing energy demand of the global community is met reliably and sustainably. The technologies created in our research departments and factories drive the energy transition and provide the base for one sixth of the world's electricity generation. Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation. Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo Our Commitment to Diversity Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences. Rewards/Benefits Be a trusted advisor to both your Internal and External Stakeholders Develop your technical and soft-skills working with cross-functional teams Take on a higher level of technical and leadership responsibilities within local and regional teams! Numerous further training opportunities (technical, soft skills etc.) are available to you on the Siemens Energy Learning platform!

Job Title: Process and Equipment Engineer (Test/Mold/Dicing/Jigsaw/Wire Bond/Die Attach)
Job Responsibilities: Job Requirements: 1) We are seeking 4 candidates proficient in Mandarin to effectively communicate with Mandarin-speaking client with below listed experiences. a) Wire Bond / Die Attach (FOL) b) Dicing / Jigsaw c) Molding /Laser Marking (EOL) d) LED Testing 2) Candidate must possess at least a Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Engineering (Electrical/Electronic), Engineering (Industrial), Engineering (Mechanical), Engineering (Others) or equivalent. 3) At least 3 year(s) of working experience in the above field or relevant experience in FOL / EOL / BGA processes. 4) Required skill(s): MS PowerPoint, MS Word & MS Excel. 5) Preferably specializing in Engineering - Electrical or equivalent. 6) Applicants must be willing to work in any subsidiary of Globetronics based in Bayan Lepas, Penang, Malaysia. Job Descriptions: 1) Able to generate engineering documents/reports (e.g. 8D, OCAP, FMEA, WI, Process Flow) 2) To do Corrective Action Plan & address the customer complaints by 8D methodology with team work, update the learning into FMEA/CP. 3) Oversee FOL/EOL/TEST processes to ensure that the process operates in full compliance within the customer specs & requests; and evaluate for improvement/s. 4) Perform equipment PM and calibration procedure as per requirement, maintained and implemented. 5) To continuously upgrade machine performance. 6) Monitor and maintain critical spares inventory system. 7) To comply to effective total preventive maintenance system to determine PM and calibration frequency as define & develop by superior. 8) Provides disposition on lots by checking and verifying the affected units based on specs and criteria, and generate corrective action. 9) Analyze results, detect issues and trace root causes that are found during the process. 10) Ensure the machine result within the specs requirement according to specs provided by costumer. 11) Perform disposition of failure and feedback to customer to get a final disposition before release the machine or lots to production. 12) Perform Daily, Monthly & Quarterly Golden Units verification to ensure that golden units or machine still in good condition. 13) Create and verify program on new products that customers request. 14) Conduct correlation, GRR and Bias Linearity to obtain accurate results. 15) Conduct process and equipment capabilities study. 16) Develop and utilize statistical method to realize product yield & productivity. 17) Liaise with customer on engineering matters.

POSITION SUMMARY: Align with AE incoming quality control requirement to develop incoming inspection and testing plan for Mechanical, Electronic parts and PCBA. Provide engineering support to IQC inspectors to ensure effective incoming inspection in compliance with specifications & requirements. RESPONSIBILITIES: Inspection of incoming materials :Ensure that all raw materials under quality inspection received from suppliers meet company quality standards and identify proper inspection methods to inspectors. Monitor cycle time of inspection and ensure no long aging backlog from IQC Inspection instruction to IQC :Prepared IQC checklist which include checking criteria and inspection methods (Identify inspection methods, reference and tools usage) for each individual part number. Documentation and Reporting : Maintain accuracy records of inspections. Generate weekly IQC report and non-netting status report for internal stakeholders Non-conformance Management : Identify defective or non-compliant materials from inspection and work with SQE team to resolve the issues This include disposition (DMR process) , supplier improvement effective date (SIIR special inspection lots monitoring) and increase on AQL sampling size. Data Analysis : Analyze inspection or purge rescreen data to identify trends, recurring defects or quality concerns. Work with SQE on the improvement as well as IQC support to monitor on supplier corrective action effectiveness Compliance with Regulatory standards : Ensure IQC record up-to date with sufficient support document and compliant to TUV, UL and ISO requirement. Continuous improvement : Contribute to the development of better inspections processess, quality standards, and methodologies to enhancethe overall quality of incoming materials. Training : Provide training and guidance to inspectors involved in material inspection, quality procedures, and compliance requirements. Support in additional task required by supervisor from time to time. Adhere to organizational requirements on quality management, health and safety, code of conduct, legal stipulations, environmental, 5S policies and general duty of care Other duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS: Ability to follow equipment calibration requirement and process, preferably have basic knowledge of operating Automatic Visual inspection machine Data analysis ability Skill of basic quality tools and quality improvement tools such as, SPC English communication skills in verbal and written. Creative ability, technical skill and independent judgment ability. PC skills, can properly present quality issues and reports with Email, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc. Knowledge of ISO9001:2015 requirements. Knowledge and understanding of ESD & Cleanroom practices. EXPERIENCE: Have in quality control or engineering experience EDUCATION: Bachelor Science in Mechanical or Electronic Engineering is preferred, or college graduation but with five years work experience. Labthink Sdn. Bhd. based in Malaysia as a customer hub in APAC to provide Sales and Aftermarket services for our valuable customers. We provide integrated professional quality control solutions for packaging manufacturers, food and beverage producers, medical and pharmaceutical, daily chemical, printing industries, automotives, electronics, battery membrane, solar panel, OLED, tobacco, adhesives and etc. We are looking for a skillful and experienced Technical Service Engineer which is customer-oriented, detail-orientated and result oriented to join our growing company to achieve customer satisfaction. Responsibilities: This is a full-time position to support Malaysia, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The main duties as below: • Involve in the installation of new equipment at customers’ sites. This includes setting up the machine, ensuring it functions correctly, and providing any necessary training to end-users. • Perform annual calibration to ensure the machines provide accurate and reliable results traceable to the national standards. • Responsible for scheduling and performing routine maintenance tasks, which may include cleaning, lubricating, and replacing parts as needed, to ensure optimal performance of equipment. • Diagnosing and troubleshooting problems when equipment malfunctions or customers encounter issues. • Upgrading and retrofitting existing or aging machine to enhance performance to meet new requirements. This could involve installing new software, updating firmware, retrofit hardware, and integrating additional features. • Conduct training to end-users on how to use and maintain the machine. • Ensure quality services deliver to customers with zero complains to achieve customer satisfaction. • Interact directly with customers to provide technical support, answer queries, and offer guidance on how to use the equipment effectively. • Update and keep accurate records of installations, maintenance activities, and repairs in service database to track the history of equipment, identifying patterns of issues, and ensuring compliance with annual calibration and preventive maintenance requirement. • Submit all required paperwork daily/weekly/monthly as per request. • Maintaining inventory necessary to meet a high first-time-fix-rate. • Require working closely with sales team, product development, and quality control. Effective communication and collaboration are essential for addressing issues and improving product / service quality. • Stay updated on the latest developments in the field. Continuous learning and training to upskill the skillset and knowledge are required. • Ensuring the safety of the equipment for users. This includes following safety protocols, conducting risk assessments, and implementing safety measures during installations and maintenance. • Service Engineers may need to be available for on-call support and travel to customers’ sites for urgent repairs over weekend or public holiday. • Be proactive in promoting and selling services such as Annual Maintenance Contract, and etc. Qualifications / Requirements • Diploma or Degree in Mechanical/Electrical/Electronics/Mechatronics Engineering with minimum 3 years relevant experience in flexible packaging, food and beverage, medical pharmaceutical, or metrology industries. Fresh graduates with good academic or technical skills are most welcome. • Worked in field service or have related experience in an engineering or manufacturing environment. • Possess own transport and willing to travel 75% of working time domestically, Southeast Asia and South Asia. • Experienced in installation, calibration, preventive maintenance, repair, and conduct training. • Knowledge of troubleshooting and problem-solving technique. The ability to analyse problems, think critically, and come up with effective solutions independently. • Expected to be familiar with computer software and hardware. • Proficiency in understanding and working with relevant technologies and systems. • The field of technology is dynamic, he/she must be adaptable to new technologies and changes in the industry. • A strong focus on customer satisfaction. He/she needs to be responsive to customer needs and dedicated to resolving issues. • Strong communication skills which can effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non- technical customers in English with oral conversation and writing. • Ability to collaborate with colleagues and other departments in well manner, working as a team. • Able keep track of job assignments and a detailed schedule. • The discipline to update service records on time and ensure data integrity. • He/she must be customer-oriented, detail-orientated and result oriented. • High ethical standards, ensuring honest and integrity, discipline and good in time management. • The desire and ability to promote and sell services such as Annual Maintenance Contract, and etc. What We Offer Be part of an international company, an innovative, competent, and dynamic organisation with worldwide presence in every country in the world: • Highly competitive salary. • Generous benefits • Insurance coverage such as hospitalisation, personal accident, and travel insurance. • Allowances for outstation • Yearly medical and dental claim • Business hours Mon – Fri, 9am – 6pm. • Work with a team of highly motivated individuals. • Opportunity to build a world-class global technology company with long-term vision for rapid growth. • Enjoy a good exposure & fast-paced work environment.

Job Summary: The Engineering Assistant Manager will manage precision engineering activities of the Costing, New Product Introduction (NPI), and CAM Programming teams. Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities. Strong communication and leadership skills for cross-functional collaboration. Proven experience in process improvement.

Job Title: Technical Account Manager, Google Cloud Consulting (English, Japanese/Korean)
Job Responsibilities: Google welcomes people with disabilities. Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Taipei, Taiwan; Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in a customer-facing role working with stakeholders, driving customer technical implementations or transformation programs. Experience supporting customers in cloud operations (e.g., launch or capacity planning, product release management), technical support, escalation management, or IT consulting. Ability to communicate in English and Japanese or Korean fluently to engage with customers in Japan or Korea. Preferred qualifications: Experience in application or workload migration to public cloud providers. Experience translating business requirements into technological solutions. Experience collaborating across business units internally and at large enterprises. Experience collaborating with channel partners, systems integrators, and third-party developers to deliver high-impact solutions. Understanding of one of the following: IT operations, database systems, networking, IT security, application development, service architecture, cloud-native application development, hosted services, storage systems, or content delivery networks. Excellent communication, presentation, problem-solving, and management skills. About the job As a Technical Account Manager (TAM), you will help customers successfully adopt Google Cloud products. You will lead the successful adoption of Google Cloud at leading organizations, guiding them through the strategic and technical facets of their cloud transformation journey. You will manage the successful delivery of Professional Services engagements to drive customer adoption of Google Cloud services, like Google Compute Engine, Google Cloud Machine Learning, Google Kubernetes Engine, BigQuery, Google Workspace, Google Chrome, and many more. In this role, you will regularly engage with diverse stakeholder groups, including executives of large enterprises and a cross-functional and geographically dispersed team. You will travel domestically and internationally approximately 25% of the time. Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems. Responsibilities Accelerate customer adoption of Google Cloud by leading the implementation journey. Provide technical guidance and manage timelines, milestones, migration goal and business transformation strategies. Advocate for customer needs in order to overcome adoption blockers and drive new feature development. Lead across multiple work streams and teams to maintain customer momentum. Develop relationships with stakeholders to understand customer’s business, develop strategic roadmaps, and lead quarterly business reviews and executive sessions to better understand business and technical needs. Plan for customer events and launches, partnering with Support, Engineers, and Site Reliability Engineers to ensure customer success, and work with customers and Support to guide issues/escalations to resolution. Develop best practices and assets based on learnings from customer engagements to support initiatives to scale through partners and accelerate Google Cloud adoption.

POSITION SUMMARY: The Sr. Commodity Specialist is responsible for providing the technical support and implementation of sourcing solutions that ensure continuity of material supply to meet Advanced Energy’s current and future business need for the assigned commodity. ESSENTIAL DUTIES: Provides support for business and strategic procurement activities related to PCB spend. Develop & maintain sustainable supply chain with competitive cost, quality, effective & lean execution. Support PCB design guideline and procedure update and support related stakeholders to resolve engineering EQs or spec related issue. Develop the approved material list, follow up the laminate qualification status and UL safety file update. Ensure that the highest ethical standards are adhered to in procurement practices. Other duties as assigned. WORK ENVIRONMENT: Location: Penang Science Park, Simpang Ampat Penang. Can work under pressure. JOB SPECIFICATION / COMPETENCY REQUIRED: Knowledge: What the incumbent must know through education, training or exposure. Basic commodity knowledge. Market trend / technology roadmap for PCB. In-depth PCB knowledge including PCB fabrication, DFM, raw material, UL certification & application. Supply and demand situation. Procurement terms and practices. BU knowledge - Business and Product. Program and Project Management. Skills: What the incumbent must be able to do. Proven or demonstrated performance developing strategic supplier relationships with good negotiation skills. Proactive problem solver with strong planning orientation and ability to work with design engineering and suppliers to meet future business need. Excellent working knowledge of purchasing, production control, and supply chain management. Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) and good command of English & Mandarin Chinese. Presentation. Excel and PowerPoint. Abilities & Behavior: Abilities and Behaviors that incumbent must be able to demonstrate and perform. Leadership. Teamwork. Target oriented. Analytical mind and decision maker. Work through priorities. Efficient task management. EXPERIENCE: Minimum 7 years' experience in supply chain management in manufacturing environment Ability to communicate with all levels in an organization. Experience in PCB manufacturing with front end engineering or process engineering role is highly prefered. Experience with a high mix / low volume part procurement environment is preferred. Experience with self-directed work teams. EDUCATION: Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Electronics / Mechanical Engineering or equivalent education and/or experience. WHY JOIN AEMY? Job Summary: The Production Supervisor – Assembly Build Box is responsible for overseeing daily production activities, ensuring workforce efficiency, managing raw materials, and maintaining equipment in optimal condition. This role requires strong leadership, process management, and problem-solving skills to enhance productivity and maintain quality standards. Key Responsibilities: 1. Workforce & Attendance Management Monitor and check attendance in all areas. Deploy manpower accordingly based on production needs. Prepare and manage manpower deployment for the night shift. Handover all absenteeism reports to the superior. 2. Production Planning & Execution Review and ensure adherence to the daily production plan. Check raw parts status (stock on hand & shortages) and inform superiors of any issues. Ensure that output and finished goods (FG) tally in the system. Verify open stock (OS) and process verification updates provided by leaders. Ensure all models meet their production targets; if not, provide a valid reason. 3. Equipment & Process Management Ensure all machines and equipment are in good working condition. Follow up on lost time incidents and report them for improvement. Ensure operators follow standard operating procedures (SOPs). Conduct blind tests for production operators to assess their competency. Conduct 5S activities before the end of the shift. 4. Shift Handover & Reporting Document and communicate all production issues in the communication book. Properly handover the shift to the night shift supervisor. Ensure all training records prepared by leaders are updated and followed up. 5. Quality & Material Management Ensure scrap tally with output to maintain accurate records. Check raw parts availability in both the store and production areas. Ensure proper tracking of materials for each model. Verify all tags prepared by leaders before stock take are correct and tally with quantity, part name, and part number. Follow up with scheduled waste management & disposal. Ensure safe use of equipment and compliance with safety standards. 6. Training & Development Conduct training sessions for leaders and maintain training records. Follow up on training schedules and documentation prepared by leaders. Job Requirements: Education: Diploma in Manufacturing, Engineering, or a related field. Experience: Minimum 2-3 years of experience in a supervisory role in manufacturing/assembly operations. Skills: Strong leadership and manpower management skills. Experience in production planning and process optimization. Ability to troubleshoot production and material-related issues. Knowledge of 5S, lean manufacturing, and safety regulations. Proficiency in basic computer operations for reporting and tracking. Why FOZ One? Global Impact: Join a company dedicated to transforming ideas into life, empowering businesses worldwide.

With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories, Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight. From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience, we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget. In addition to our flagship brand, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria, LXR, Conrad, Canopy, Curio Collection, DoubleTree, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton and many others. If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member. Because it’s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests, Team Members, and owners alike. The Sous Chef will manage and lead the team to ensure smooth running culinary operation and maximize the level of standard in the hotel’s kitchen. What will I be doing? As the Sous Chef, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards: Plan, prepare and implement high quality food and beverage products, and set-ups in all areas in the restaurant. Work seamlessly with recipes, standards and plating guides. Maintain all HACCP aspects within the hotel operation. Use appropriately all equipment, tools and machines. Focus on constant improvement of training manuals and SOPs. Participate actively in quality initiatives such as daily Chef briefings and monthly team meetings in order to constantly improve the culinary operation, meet targets and keep communication flowing. Work on offsite events when requested. Complete tasks and jobs outside of the kitchen area. Assist in inventory taking. Knowledgeable of hotel’s occupancy, events, forecasts and achievements. Prepare menus as requested, in a timely fashion. Work on new dishes for food tastings and photo taking. Control stations within the kitchen. Work closely with the Stewarding department to ensure high levels of cleanliness and low levels of lost and breakages. Effectively respond to guests’ requests. Learn and adapt to changes. Be receptive to constructive feedback. Purchase for and control production. Maintain at all times a professional and positive attitude towards team members and supervisors. Adhere to established hotel rules and team member handbook, ensuring all team members under your supervision do so as well for the department to operate smoothly. Coordinate, organize and participate in all production pertaining to the kitchen. Check and follow-up on the assembling of ingredients and equipment for the ala carte menu, daily menus and seasonal specials, maintaining the standards of pre-set recipes, portion control and costing at all times. Be disciplined and adhere to proper work practices at all times for yourself and team members assigned to you. Maintain good personal hygiene, clean uniforms, proper sanitation and cleanliness of the workstations and work tools. Be aware of the dangers of contaminated food and ensure ingredients in the refrigerators are checked and replaced appropriately. Report to the Executive Chef on any issues and take appropriate action. Follow-up on changes in new recipes or work methods pertaining to new menus, daily specials, and promotional activities as instructed by the Executive Sous Chef. Work closely with the Executive Sous Chef in determining the quantity of food items and ingredients to be produced, bought or prepared for that day. Exercise maximum control on wastage to achieve optimum profitability. Check all equipment belonging to the department and make sure that all are in good working order, and if necessary, report faults or problems to the Executive Sous Chef. Prepare the necessary work orders for the Engineering department. Ensure that recipes and costings are established and updated. Monitor food quality and quantity to ensure the most economical usage of ingredients. Check that the quality of food prepared by team members meet the required standard and make necessary adjustments. Select team members who display qualities and attributes that reflect department standards. Manage the training function and ensure all team members are certified in their position before taking charge of an area of responsibility. Monitor overall food operation and ensure that food items are being prepared in a timely and correct manner. Oversee the cleanliness, hygiene and maintenance of the kitchen and undertake steps necessary to maintain the highest possible standards in this area. Control, monitor and be responsible for food costs to yield the maximum amount of outlet profit and maximum guest satisfaction. Review all timesheets to ensure that team members’ work times and meal breaks are accurate. Understand, practice and promote teamwork to achieve missions, goals, and overall departmental standards. Ensure that team members have a complete understanding of and adhere to the hotel’s team member rules and regulations. The Management reserves the right to make changes to this job description at its sole discretion and without advance notice. Carry out any other reasonable duties and responsibilities as assigned. What are we looking for? A Sous Chef, serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow: High School graduate or above. 5 years as cook in a Chinese / Banquet / Main / Pastry Kitchen in a 5-star category hotel or individual restaurant with high standards. At least 3 years as a Chef de Partie or 1 year equivalent position in an international brand hotel. Possess a valid health certificate. Knowledgeable with cooking techniques such as boiling, frying, stewing, reduction, simmering, steaming, baking, soup making, and dry goods preparation (for Chinese / Banquet Kitchen). Possess a variety of boiling, frying, stewing, reduction, simmering, steaming, baking, boiling, barbeque and dressing techniques (for Main Kitchen). Have a variety of pastry, chocolate and bread making techniques (for Pastry Kitchen). A dynamic and creative individual who brings a vast and varied experience in culinary arts, menu design and food promotions. A hands-on trainer who coaches and leads by example, motivates and impresses upon the team the right attitude and spirit of culinary excellence. Able to work with and consume all products and ingredients. Able to convert recipes and follow them through. Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel. Able to set priorities and complete tasks in a timely manner. Work well in stress situations, remain calm under pressure and able to solve problems. Excellent leadership skills. Knowledgeable in HACCP. Technical education in hospitality or culinary school preferred. Good command in English, both verbal and written to meet business needs, preferred. Work experience in similar capacity with international chain hotels preferred. What will it be like to work for Hilton? Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travellers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!
